$interpreted: Puggi: And then, trapped by the Gambler King, caged like rats, just when it seemed like certain death...
Puggi: Puggi the heroic—Puggi the masterful—breaks free from his chains!
Puggi: He frees himself from captivity! And with a left hook *POW* and a Puggi Punch *SLAM*
Puggi: they take down each and every one of the Gambler King's cronies!!
Yan Bo: Oooh! So heroic, Puggi the hero! And do tell, what happens next!?
Pang: How did you get out of the cage?
Puggi: That's not important! The point is—
Puggi: The hero saved the Oasis Casino, and legend spoke of him for generations to come!
Joan: Master, I'm here to see you!
Puggi: Ooh! My disciples!
Puggi: Come, tell them of your master's adventures in the Desert Kingdom!
Hestia: Joan! Did you bring the latest "Bad Prince" for me!?
Joan: You know it~ I had to line up all morning for this, ran over here the second I finished!
Sharice: Umm... did you happen to see "Spoiled by a Beast"...?
Joan: Ah, sorryyy... the next one isn't out yet~
Joan: Wait, Sharice—you like romance books!?
Sharice: Ah, I mean... no! I'm just looking to kill some time... I would never care about... hunky beasts or... cute princes...
Pang: You've been really obsessed with these books lately. May I ask what they're about?
Joan: (He helped pick up my book and... he's asking about it... is he into me!?)
Sharice: Joan, why'd your face go red?
Joan: Too bad I don't like... big furry men~
Sharice: Huh? What's wrong with fur?
Puggi: Oooo~ So Sharice likes 'em hairy, huh? That must mean I'm your ideal man...
Sharice: Shut up, Puggi!
Hestia: Hey! could you guys calm down!?
Joan: If we're talking about the fur scale, it's obviously better to be on the less-furry side.
Pang: Always arguing about these trivial things...
Yan Bo: And what is the harm in that? ~For precious friends hid in death's dateless night, Then thou whose shadow shadows doth make bright~
Pang: Precious friends...
Pang: Back then, my comrades and I... we would sometimes banter like that...
Yan Bo: Missing home, you are? And soon should be the Martial Arts Tournament, yes? Only one every twenty years.

Pang: When I was a child, Yao and I made it our goal to enter the tournament...

If he were still here; If I were still in the tribe... I wonder how things would be different.
Yan Bo: What a shame, the fate of your friend Yao. A prince, no less...
Pang: He couldn't accept the Alliance, all the corruption... He died standing up for what he believed in.
Pang: And I could neither stop him nor help him... I deserved to be exiled.
Puggi: You! You dare defy me, the main character!? Then I must unleash my final form!
Sharice: Uh, then why are you hiding behind Pang?
Puggi: Because Pang's my final form!
Pang: Puggi, what are you doing...?
Pang: I'm no "final form".
Puggi: Pang, you traitor!

Yan Bo: Sometimes you must reflect on the past, in order to cherish the present. What is that poem... 

~But if the while I think on thee, dear friend, 
Want nothing that the thought of hearts can mend~ 
(I think that's right?)
Pang: Wait... something's wrong!
Mad Tiger Guard: Murderer! Hand over the Tiger Tribe's talisman!
Pang: Who are...!?
Pang: What is your purpose here?
Mad Tiger Guard: Save it! We've been ordered to bring you and the talisman back to the Tiger Tribe!
Pang: Bring me back? Orders from the Alliance, no? What does this have to do with the holy talisman?
Mad Tiger Guard: No, not from the damned Alliance. You killed General Yu and stole his talisman—the Tiger Tribe won't let this slide!
Pang: What? General Yu is...!?
Pang: I've been exiled from the tribe for years, forbidden to return. How could I have a hand in General Yu's death?
Mad Tiger Guard: The Alliance wants to put the blame on the Insect Tribe. Thankfully, General Shun had the wherewithal to call for an autopsy.
Mad Tiger Guard: When we discovered that the holy talisman was missing, we were sure that something suspicious was going on!
Pang: So General Shun has sent you here, behind the Alliance's back? Well, this is the first I've heard of anything. I think you've got the wrong tiger.

Mad Tiger Guard: Hmph! You know it's Tiger Tribe tradition that the prior tournament contestant keeps hold of the holy talisman. 

If someone were to want it, they'd have to challenge him.
Mad Tiger Guard: You've been planning to kill General Yu for ages now, haven't you!
Pang: This tradition isn't a secret. It could have been anyone with an interest in the talisman...
Mad Tiger Guard: Lies! General Yu's lethal wounds were found in the same spot that Yao had attacked him in all those years ago!
Mad Tiger Guard: And as Yao's conspirator, you're the only one who could have known about those old wounds! The General's one weak point!
Pang: Did you just say... Yao!?

Model.Text: And then, trapped by the Gambler King, caged like rats, just when it seemed like certain death...
Puggi the heroic—Puggi the masterful—breaks free from his chains!
He frees himself from captivity! And with a left hook *POW* and a Puggi Punch *SLAM*
they take down each and every one of the Gambler King's cronies!!
Oooh! So heroic, Puggi the hero! And do tell, what happens next!?
How did you get out of the cage?
That's not important! The point is—
The hero saved the Oasis Casino, and legend spoke of him for generations to come!
Master, I'm here to see you!
Ooh! My disciples!
Come, tell them of your master's adventures in the Desert Kingdom!
Joan! Did you bring the latest "Bad Prince" for me!?
You know it~ I had to line up all morning for this, ran over here the second I finished!
Umm... did you happen to see "Spoiled by a Beast"...?
Ah, sorryyy... the next one isn't out yet~
Wait, Sharice—you like romance books!?
Ah, I mean... no! I'm just looking to kill some time... I would never care about... hunky beasts or... cute princes...
You've been really obsessed with these books lately. May I ask what they're about?
(He helped pick up my book and... he's asking about it... is he into me!?)
Joan, why'd your face go red?
Too bad I don't like... big furry men~
Huh? What's wrong with fur?
Oooo~ So Sharice likes 'em hairy, huh? That must mean I'm your ideal man...
Shut up, Puggi!
Hey! could you guys calm down!?
If we're talking about the fur scale, it's obviously better to be on the less-furry side.
Always arguing about these trivial things...
And what is the harm in that? ~For precious friends hid in death's dateless night, Then thou whose shadow shadows doth make bright~
Precious friends...
Back then, my comrades and I... we would sometimes banter like that...
Missing home, you are? And soon should be the Martial Arts Tournament, yes? Only one every twenty years.

When I was a child, Yao and I made it our goal to enter the tournament...

If he were still here; If I were still in the tribe... I wonder how things would be different.
What a shame, the fate of your friend Yao. A prince, no less...
He couldn't accept the Alliance, all the corruption... He died standing up for what he believed in.
And I could neither stop him nor help him... I deserved to be exiled.
You! You dare defy me, the main character!? Then I must unleash my final form!
Uh, then why are you hiding behind Pang?
Because Pang's my final form!
Puggi, what are you doing...?
I'm no "final form".
Pang, you traitor!

Sometimes you must reflect on the past, in order to cherish the present. What is that poem... 

~But if the while I think on thee, dear friend, 
Want nothing that the thought of hearts can mend~ 
(I think that's right?)
Wait... something's wrong!
Murderer! Hand over the Tiger Tribe's talisman!
Who are...!?
What is your purpose here?
Save it! We've been ordered to bring you and the talisman back to the Tiger Tribe!
Bring me back? Orders from the Alliance, no? What does this have to do with the holy talisman?
No, not from the damned Alliance. You killed General Yu and stole his talisman—the Tiger Tribe won't let this slide!
What? General Yu is...!?
I've been exiled from the tribe for years, forbidden to return. How could I have a hand in General Yu's death?
The Alliance wants to put the blame on the Insect Tribe. Thankfully, General Shun had the wherewithal to call for an autopsy.
When we discovered that the holy talisman was missing, we were sure that something suspicious was going on!
So General Shun has sent you here, behind the Alliance's back? Well, this is the first I've heard of anything. I think you've got the wrong tiger.

Hmph! You know it's Tiger Tribe tradition that the prior tournament contestant keeps hold of the holy talisman. 

If someone were to want it, they'd have to challenge him.
You've been planning to kill General Yu for ages now, haven't you!
This tradition isn't a secret. It could have been anyone with an interest in the talisman...
Lies! General Yu's lethal wounds were found in the same spot that Yao had attacked him in all those years ago!
And as Yao's conspirator, you're the only one who could have known about those old wounds! The General's one weak point!
Did you just say... Yao!?
